column1: MRI snapshot size (256, 256, 1) with weighting in T2, illustrating the head of a man of 37 years old, in slice coronal n°70 starting from the back of the skull. The image notably reveals the presence of: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 2847.6562 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 3816.6504 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 212.2559 mm³, the left thalamus of volume 40.8691 mm³, the left caudate nucleus of volume 109.4238 mm³, the left putamen of volume 191.1621 mm³, the left globus pallidus of volume 125.2441 mm³, the third ventricle of volume 63.2812 mm³, the left amygdala of volume 259.7168 mm³, the left ventral diencephalon of volume 163.4766 mm³, the left vessel of volume 2.6367 mm³, the white matter of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 3022.9980 mm³, the cortex of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 3840.3809 mm³, the right lateral ventricle of volume 183.2520 mm³, the right thalamus proper of volume 101.5137 mm³, the right caudate nucleus of volume 77.7832 mm³, the right putamen of volume 196.4355 mm³, the right globus pallidus of volume 125.2441 mm³, the right amygdala of volume 274.2188 mm³, the right ventral diencephalon of volume 154.2480 mm³ and the right vessel of volume 5.2734 mm³.
